result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Collins, Ron Mazun

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: NOTICE OF RIGHT TO SEEK POSTCONVICTION RELIEF
DEF PRESENT IN CUSTODY W/ATTY JOHNEN - CASE DISMISSED & READ IN
to Transport
Letter received from Attorney Johnen to Judge Rice dated October 2, 2015.
Review Hearing and Arraignment dated April 21, 2015 (original in 14CF183)
Defendant appears via VTC with Attorney Hamm (special appearance).  Court orders $250 Cash Bond with conditions.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose.
No controlled substance without a valid prescription in own name.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed to drive in Wisconsin.
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM.  UPON POSTING OF THE BOND, DEFENDANT MUST APPEAR AT THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE TO SIGN UP DURING THE HOURS OF 8:00 A.M. - 4:30 P.M.  THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE IS LOCATED AT 919 HOESCHLER DRIVE, SUITE 100, SPARTA, WI.
Curfew 7pm-7am except work purposes, treatment purposes, NA or AA as approved by the Bond Monitoring Program.
Defendant can be release Monday - Friday only between the hours of 8:00 am - 3:30 pm, if defendant is released on a Saturday or Sunday, defendant can only be released 3:30pm-6pm, so defendant can report to the Bond Monitoring Program immediately once released.
Defendant must report to the Bond Monitoring Program Office immediately upon release from custody.
IN CUSTODY
BODY ONLY - DEFENDANT IS ALLEGED TO HAVE VIOLATED THE RULES OF THE MONROE COUNTY BOND MONITORING PROGRAM
Order to Detain
Hearing at 10-15-2015 09:00 am
Defendant present in custody w/Atty Johnen - trial to be scheduled
No status notification letter received.
Defendant appears via VTC with Attorney Johnen by telephone.  Court reinstates previous bond and conditions.
IN CUSTODY
BODY ONLY- ALLEGED TO HAVE VIOLATED THE RULES OF THE MONROE COUNTY BOND MONITORING PROGRAM.
to Detain

to Withdraw as Defendant's Counsel

Defendant appears in person with Attorney Hamm.  Reading waived.  Not Guilty plea entered.

Status Conference- June 1, 2015 @ 3:00 p.m.
Exhibit 1- Certified Copy of Bond (14CF183)
Defendant appears in person with Attorney Hamm.  Exhibit 1 received.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed.  Reading waived.
Defendant's
KENNETH HAMM APPOINTED
Preliminary hearing on April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant appears via VTC with Attorney Hamm.  Defendant waives reading.  Court gives the right to a preliminary hearing within 20 days.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within time limits.  Attorney Hamm to schedule preliminary hearing.
